definition: to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone

sentences.english: You'll just love Tuesdays. Do you like to swear?
sentences.chinese: 週二你一定很爽，你愛罵人嗎？

sentences.english: Of oaths and gibberish frightening girls and boys.
sentences.chinese: 用洋話罵人嚇唬男孩和女娃。

sentences.english: He became abusive when he was drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他喝醉時就滿口髒話罵人了。

sentences.english: But, like Smith, Jingsheng doesn't mean to scold or otherwise sit in judgment.
sentences.chinese: 但是，像史密斯，景並不意味着罵人或坐在判斷。

sentences.english: Never fart, burp, or cuss in public.
sentences.chinese: 永遠不要在公共場所放屁，打嗝或者罵人。

sentences.english: It is now freely applied as an adjective of an opprobrious kind.
sentences.chinese: 目前它被任意用作一種罵人的形容詞。

sentences.english: He usually calls other's name without saying dirty words.
sentences.chinese: 他經常罵人不帶髒字兒。

sentences.english: Well, hope your temper a little better, not apt to curse Oh.
sentences.chinese: 唉，希望你們的脾氣好一點，不要動不動就罵人噢。

sentences.english: You say he abuses people, but even this is not unusual.
sentences.chinese: 你說他罵人，但即便是這點也並非不同尋常。

sentences.english: Because who needs to hear people cursing like Tourette's patients on speed and failing to work together?
sentences.chinese: 有誰願意聽他們滔滔不絕的罵人並導致團隊解散嗎？

sentences.english: At the time the F word was nowhere near being documented as an English swear-word.
sentences.chinese: 當時，F打頭的那個詞還遠沒成爲英語中罵人的詞。

sentences.english: Excuse the swear-words I shall use.
sentences.chinese: 原諒我要說罵人的話了。

sentences.english: Both cursing and arm crossing could reduce emotional torment.
sentences.chinese: 罵人和抱臂可以降低情感痛苦。
張嘴罵人之前先倒數十秒。

sentences.english: Then, send the manager to the stands for his outburst.
sentences.chinese: 第二，因爲主教練的罵人行爲而將他送上開臺。

sentences.english: The easiest way to be on TV is to call somebody a name.
sentences.chinese: 要想上電視，最簡捷的辦法就是罵人。

definition: to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
variant of 裝屄|装屄[zhuang1 bi1]
unable to make sense of what one is hearing
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
